title: Criminal Law Reforms - Many Concerns that need addressing
selftext:
Hello All, the committee responsible for reforms in the Criminal Laws has allowed consultations only until today as the deadline. There are some serious concerns with the way this committee has been constituted and the speed with which they are trying to reform Indian Criminal Laws. As of now, they have the IPC, CRPC and IEA under the scanner.

The following picture highlights the concerns with this reform committee.

https://preview.redd.it/5d0pcwk1f0s51.jpg?width=1739&format=pjpg&auto=webp&s=db9c4a1b3090851acde267634020773e84f49560

Please take some time to visit [disbandthecommittee.in](https://disbandthecommittee.in) and send in your mails. This is the time to raise our voices.

Here's a video where Anubha Bhonsle explains the issues with this reform committee too. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dftNVOmmdfM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dftNVOmmdfM)
comments: Committee under the home ministry? Masterstroke incoming
So basically, 5 guys coordinating on Zoom calls, will rewrite 250 year old laws within 6 months? In a pandemic under Amit Shah's directions? Can't see that going wrong...
Exactly.. We know how much the Home Ministry cares about laws that support people.
